NarrPara.Content:
\section{Testing logical quantifiers}
Universal quantifiers with no bound variables.
Universal quantifiers with one bound variable.
Universal quantifiers with multiple bound variables.
Existential quantifiers with no bound variables.
Existential quantifiers with one bound variable.
Existential quantifiers with multiple bound variables.

TODO: it would be nice to have some way of testing that a predicate is undefined (that is, its truth value is unknown according to the Z standard semantics), but this would be an extension of standard Z syntax. If we added such syntax, then we could check that: (\exists S@P) is undefined when P is never true, but sometimes undefined. (\forall S@P) is undefined when P is sometimes undefined. \end{document}
